node.title: Adelaide Oval mandates double COVID vaccinations to all visitors and events
node.alt: A general view of Adelaide Oval with no spectators in attendance during an AFL match.
node.description: Adelaide Oval announcesÂ it will become a double-vaccination only venue from November 23, when South Australia's borders open.
node.content:
["Adelaide Oval has announced it will become a double-vaccination only venue from November 23,\u00a0when South Australia's borders open.", "Proof of double vaccination will be required of all game and event patrons, all functions and events guests and all visitors to the stadium.", "It will also include anyone taking part in the RoofClimb.", "Patrons aged 12 and over will only be admitted to the venue if they provide proof of vaccination or a valid exemption.", "Crowds of up to 35,000 will be admitted to the 52,000 capacity stadium for the Ashes Test beginning on December 16.", "People will be required to wear a mask at all times other than when eating or drinking.", "\"We will be enforcing this requirement because it is a very important safety and welfare issue,\" the Stadium Management Authority chief executive Andrew Daniels\u00a0said.", "\"Our job is to show absolute clarity to our patrons, to make sure people are comfortable and confident that when they come to the Adelaide Oval, it is a very covid-safe environment.", "Mr Daniels said he expected the mandate to be in place for a \"long period of time\" and therefore include the 2022 AFL season.", "He said officials would be checking proof of vaccinations on phones or alternatively visitors could show a hard copy of their vaccination certificate along with proof of identification.", "\"There may be an increase in wait times to get in, but we need to maintain appropriate social distancing amongst people in the queues,\" he said.", "
Ambulance intern intake doubled
", "Meanwhile, the\u00a0South Australian Ambulance Service has doubled its intern intake and will train university students to support paramedics in dealing with the caseload from COVID-19 outbreaks.", "", "
SA Health Minister Stephen Wade speaks with new ambulance interns.(ABC News: Eric Tolcek)
", "SAAS has outlined its \"COVID-19 Resilience Plan\", which includes the recruitment of 20 extra emergency call takers and the reallocation of corporate staff to help with non-emergency patient transfers.", "The service said it would also increase its ambulance fleet, hold off decommissioning old vehicles and use private providers for non-urgent jobs.", "The service has hired 96 interns this year, instead of 48, in addition to the 74 extra paramedics the government is recruiting.", "\"It's ready for whatever comes in terms of COVID,\" Health Minister Stephen Wade said.", "SAAS chief executive Rob Elliott said the ambulance service had three phases to their COVID plan.", "\"There's very immediate phase where we're looking to do some immediate actions, some planning and some training to prepare us for next year,\" he said."]
